Node.definition: = action in which humans or deities respond to a question or situation, either by words or by actions
= man; ◄ Shuhite (שׁוּחִי) ► friend of Job (אִיֹּוב) who comes to comfort but concludes by arguing with Job
= member of ethnic group ◄ possibly founded by Shuah (שׁוּחַ) son of Abraham (אַבְרָהָם) and Keturah (קְטוּרָה)

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
particle linking an event to a point in time; = relation indicating that event X ends at point in time Y

= referent to an unknown point in time; ► normally used with the purpose of finding out which point in time is intended; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that this point of time may never arrive

Node.gloss: to place|to put|to lay|to set|to keep
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or deities cause objects or (other) humans to be located in a certain place
= object used for catching animals

Node.gloss: to consider|to pay heed|to perceive|to realize|to understand|to distinguish
Node.definition: = process by which someone gains knowledge and understanding by observing carefully in order to see through the outward appearance of things and grasp their essence
= referent to the time after the event in focus

= action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually not directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= to hold the opinion that a particular object, person, or event is to be identified with, considered similar to, or to be equated with another object, person, or event
often used as collective: = general term for any land animal, as opposed to humans (אָדָם) birds (עֹוף) reptiles (רֶמֶשׂ) insects (שֶׁרֶץ) and fish (דָּג)

Node.gloss: to be considered stupid|to be considered unclean
Node.definition: exact meaning unsure; possibly: = state in which humans are considered unworthy of respect, because they are considered stupid or unclean

= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used to see things, after which the observed information is stored and processed in the mind; sparkling when the body is healthy and strong, but dim when weak or sick; the eyes also play a significant role in determining whether a person is considered beautiful or not; eyes can reflect both an attitude of compassion and a sentiment of malice; ≈ high eyes are associated with pride, whereas lowly eyes are connected with humility; a good eye is associated with generosity, whereas an evil eye denotes stinginess; winking the eye is associated with underhanded practices

Node.gloss: to tear to pieces|to maul|to mangle
Node.definition: = action by which a person or animal is cut up and killed with one's claws and/or teeth ► for food or in order to enlarge one's territory; ≈ associated with terrifying and deadly viciousness

literally: throat, as the part of the body that contains the passage ways for blood, air, and food; hence: = the life principle that animates both humans and animals, turns them into breathing living beings, and functions as the center of their personality, mind, physical and non physical desires, courage, emotions, and affections; it is believed to reside in the blood
= state of extreme displeasure; ≈ often associated with fire and smoke
marker denoting that the truth value of the following statement is under investigation
= action by which humans or deities move away from an object, person, or place

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= process by which rocks move spontaneously from one place to another
= mass of rock projecting and forming an elevation
marker expressing a speaker's confirmation of the truth of a statement; in some cases the truth of this statement is conceded

= light as a physical phenomenon, mainly observed during daytime, and the opposite of darkness; ◄ one of God's most important attributes; first created by God and since produced by sun, moon, and stars, but also by fire; ► enables people and animals to see; ≈ associated with life, goodness, happiness, prosperity, security, favor, and wisdom, loved by the righteous, and hated by the wicked
= process by which a fire or light is put out; ≈ associated with the beginning of difficult times, and sometimes even death
= process by which an object gives out or reflects a bright light
= hot glowing body of fire

= state of burning, in which substances combine chemically with oxygen from the air and give out bright light, heat, and smoke; ► used for cooking, melting, cleansing, heating, and destroying; ≈ many aspects of life are compared with fire, such as anger, jealousy, aggression, wickedness, words, life, certain sicknesses, suffering, etc.

= light as a physical phenomenon, mainly observed during daytime, and the opposite of darkness; ◄ one of God's most important attributes; first created by God and since produced by sun, moon, and stars, but also by fire; ► enables people and animals to see; ≈ associated with life, goodness, happiness, prosperity, security, favor, and wisdom, loved by the righteous, and hated by the wicked

= process by which the light gradually disappears, ◄ caused by the fact that the light of sun, moon, and stars can no longer reach the location that is in focus, ► resulting in a state in which no one can readily see, and colors and shapes can no longer be distinguished; loved by the wicked only; ≈ associated with hardship, death, and lack of enlightenment
= location where a family or household lives, or where a deity is said to reside

= small container ◄ made out of earthenware, ► filled with oil (שֶׁמֶן) and with a wick (פִּשְׁתָּה) placed in it; sometimes placed on a lampstand (מְנֹורָה) used as a source of light (אֹור) ≈ associated with peace, stability and well being
= process by which a fire or light is put out; ≈ associated with the beginning of difficult times, and sometimes even death

Node.gloss: to be hindered|to be impeded|to be restricted
Node.definition: = state in which an event cannot take place in exactly the way it is intended because of something that hinders it
= state of being physically strong and healthy which usually includes the ability of producing children|read אָוֶן (אָוֶן)
= causative action by which humans or deities commission one or more agents to go to a certain individual or place in order to perform a certain task
= net of unknown size and shape; ► used for hunting birds and other animals, and also for fishing; ≈ associated with aggression and control
literally: foot, here used metonymically to denote the entire person or animal owning it; hence: = a human being or animal with focus on the activities for which they use their feet
= network of branches and twigs which covers and hides a hole or pit; ► used for catching animals; ≈ associated with aggression and control
= action by which humans, deities, or animals move through an area without a specific destination

Node.gloss: to grasp|to take hold of (something)|to seize|to catch|to hold on (to something)
Node.definition: = to take hold of someone or something; humans typically do this with their hands and animals use their mouths; however, it is often extended to include inanimate objects (traps), personalized qualities (wisdom), emotions (anger, fear), or processes (time)
= the back part of the foot of humans and animals below the ankle
= contraption; ► used for catching animals; ≈ associated with aggression and control

Node.gloss: to seize|to hold|to take hold|to grasp|to handle
Node.definition: = action by which humans take hold of other humans or objects with their hands; the agent role is often extended figuratively to include objects, deities and certain conditions
exact meaning unsure; possibly: = some kind of woven material or mesh that entangles the feet; ► used for catching animals; ≈ associated with aggression and control
= causative action by which humans cause other humans or objects to be invisible so that their location cannot be determined, which is often achieved by burying them or by covering them

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

= rope tied into a noose, attached to the other end to a bent bough or small tree that springs upright and tightens the noose around the victim when the trap is sprung; ► used for hunting animals; ≈ associated with aggression and control
= contraption; ► used for catching animals; ≈ associated with aggression and control
= causative process by which a specific event causes someone else to be in deep distress
= something that instills an intense and overpowering fear in someone else; ≈ often associated with death and darkness
literally: at the feet; hence: = a reference to the location behind a moving party
= condition of not having food to eat, often leading to weakness

= state in which humans are suffering caused by difficult circumstances; ≈ often seen as the consequences of their own wickedness|= state of being physically strong and healthy which usually includes the ability of producing children|= material possessions such as gold, silver, animals and slaves; ► usually results in a position of honor and power
= extremely difficult circumstances ► resulting in grief, poverty, sickness, and/or death
literally: to be established; hence: = state in which all the steps have been taken that are needed for an event to take place
= action by which people or objects are removed from existence in a violent way ◄ as food that is eaten
= state in which an object is an integrated part of a larger unit or substance
= the thin layer of tissue forming the natural outer covering of the body of a person or animal
= action by which people or objects are removed from existence in a violent way ◄ as food that is eaten
= state in which an object is an integrated part of a larger unit or substance
= first offspring of any female; ► in the case of humans, the main heir of estate and blessing
= process by which humans or animals stop living
= location where a family or household lives, or where a deity is said to reside
= state in which humans live with confidence and without fear; ≈ often regarded as carelessness, especially when there is no mention of trust in YHWH
= causative action by which humans cause other humans to move purposefully in a direction
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity
= something that instills an intense and overpowering fear in someone else; ≈ often associated with death and darkness
= location where a family or household lives, or where a deity is said to reside
= particle marking a proposition as not true
= causative action by which humans cause a substance or a set of small objects to divide itself and move into various directions

= a pale yellow substance which burns readily in air; ◄ it is found in regions of vulcanic activity such as the Dead Sea area, and ► causes land to be infertile; ≈ it is associated with punishment from God
= a part of a plant normally below ground, which acts as a support and collects water and nourishment, ≈ associated with well being, offspring, and the inclination of the mind
= process by which objects containing liquid essential to their existence lose these liquids ◄ due to some external or internal cause
literally: remembrance; hence: = appellation through which one can be remembered

Node.gloss: to perish|to come to an end
Node.definition: = process by which an event comes to an end, usually under unfavorable circumstances

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= one or more words by which a person, deity, place or object is known, addressed, remembered, or referred to; ≈ regarded as a core element of one's identity
= area outside of living quarters; ► used as thoroughfare
= causative action by which someone causes others to move away from a certain place by force, ◄ as if by physically pushing them away

= light as a physical phenomenon, mainly observed during daytime, and the opposite of darkness; ◄ one of God's most important attributes; first created by God and since produced by sun, moon, and stars, but also by fire; ► enables people and animals to see; ≈ associated with life, goodness, happiness, prosperity, security, favor, and wisdom, loved by the righteous, and hated by the wicked

= state in which there is no light, ◄ caused by the fact that the light of sun, moon, and stars cannot reach the location that is in focus, ► resulting in a state in which no one can readily see, and colors and shapes can no longer be distinguished; loved by the wicked only; ≈ associated with hardship, ignorance, death, and oblivion
primarily used in poetry: = the earth as opposed to the sky, with special focus on the area that is inhabited by humans

Node.gloss: to drive out|to drive away|to banish|to reject
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans force other humans to leave a certain location
= a person's descendants
= a person's descendants

Node.gloss: there is not|it is not|it does not
Node.definition: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non existant
= a person who was able to flee from danger
= state in which humans live in a place which is not their place of origin or nationality, either permanently or for a substantial period of time

= a basic unit of time, including evening (עֶרֶב) and morning (בֹּקֶר) seven days make a week (שְׁבוּעָה) sometimes used in a figurative sense referring to a limited period of time, which may be shorter or slightly longer than a single day; the context often makes it difficult to determine
= pertaining to being located behind other objects in a row
= state in which animate or inanimate objects are located to the east of the speaker

Node.gloss: to be held|to be caught|to be fastened|to be attached|to be girded
Node.definition: = to be held in position firmly in a certain place
= particle limiting the focus to one phrase and so enhancing its truth value
= marker identifying a set of multiple objects with a set that already exists in the mind of the hearers
= location where a family or household lives, or where a deity is said to reside
literally: to know (God); hence: = action by which humans, either as individuals or as groups, assume a position of subservience towards a deity
with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth
